img.title: Miss NC

a.h3: A Visit from Miss North Carolina, Alexandra Badgett

div.h1: Corvian Community School Receives National Accreditation from Cognia

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;color:#ffffff

p.span: Corvian Community School has received its accreditation from Cognia. Cognia, formerly AdvancED, nationally recognizes districts that meet rigorous standards focused on productive learning environments, equitable resource allocation that meets the needs of learners, and effective leadership. Earning accreditation from the Cognia Global Accreditation Commission means that the school is accredited, and that Corvian Community School is recognized across the nation as a school that meets Cognia Standards of Quality, and maintains a commitment to continuous improvement. We are thrilled that Corvian has achieved this honor!

div.span: When these students were asked why they love Corvian, they agreed that Corvian is a welcoming environment and whenever new people come to the school, they make friends quickly.

Corvian is passion personified. Each child who passes through the school isn’t seen as just a student, but an individual with potential for growth and success in all walks of life. Teachers and staff members pour their heart and soul into every single child to ensure that they are all receiving the instruction and love they need to be successful. Every day, our building is bursting at the seams with students who are passionate and eager to learn and staff members who are loving and focused on molding their students into well-rounded members of our community. Corvian serves as an incredible beacon of light in the lives of everybody it touches and I could not be more proud and fortunate to be a part of such an incredible community!

At Corvian, all children are viewed as unique individuals. All are accommodated for their strengths and weaknesses. And above all, all are treated with love and respect, a mode of interaction that they, in turn, employ with one another. When children feel loved and respected by their teachers and their peers, they can focus, unfettered, upon the educational tasks at hand. Corvian is truly an exceptional place and I am grateful every day for the exceptional education that my children are receiving there.

The thing I love about teaching at Corvian is that the learning environment is so warm and welcoming and the students are respectful to everyone. I rarely see anyone sitting or playing alone and our students always welcome new friends with open arms, showing them the Corvian Way.

Our daughter has attended Corvian for the last 5 years. And as each year passes, we are more amazed by her quest for knowledge and willingness to learn, her compassion towards her classmates and the world in general and the imagination for what her future holds for her. All of these traits are guided by the environment she is exposed to in school each day including her amazing teachers and staff with engaging attitudes and curriculum, wonderful friends, service and character building activities and the overall culture of caring and involvement.
I don't want to leave school.- 4th Grade Student
